item.title: China Rolls out $72 Billion in Tax Breaks for New-Energy Vehicles
item.description: China unveiled a package of tax breaks aimed at boosting the purchase of electric vehicles over the next four years.

item.title: FTSE 100 Falls as UK Inflation Data Fuel Rate-Rise Bets
item.description: The FTSE 100 fell 0.4%, led by housebuilders, as the inflation data fuelled expectations about further BOE rate rises, which would add to the squeeze on mortgage holders and dampen demand in the property market, Interactive Investors said.

item.title: Gold to Remain Elevated in 2023 and 2024 as Fed Nears End of Hiking Cycle
item.description: Gold prices are likely to stay high through 2023 and into 2024, with a combination of global financial instability and with the Fed coming to the end of its interest-rate hiking cycle likely to bolster prices, Fitch said.

item.title: Sterling Erases Initial Gains After UK Inflation Data
item.description: Sterling erased its initial gains after the higher-than-expected U.K. inflation data, reflecting the market’s already aggressive interest-rate rise expectations for the BOE, ING said.

item.title: Oil Edges Up Amid Mixed Signals
item.description: Oil prices edged up in Europe, continuing a stretch of sideways trading as the market is caught between conflicting demand drivers.

item.title: Eurozone Government Bond Yields Rise After UK Inflation Data
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields rose, tracking sharp gains for gilt yields on the higher-than-expected U.K. inflation data, which makes further BOE rate increases more likely, feeding through into European bond moves.

item.title: Noises Detected in Hunt for Missing Titanic Submersible
item.description: Canadian aircraft detected underwater noises in the search for a missing submersible, the U.S. Coast Guard said, as the clock ticks down in the race to find the crew before their air supply runs out.

item.title: UK Inflation Unexpectedly Holds Steady
item.description: Consumer prices in the U.K. were 8.7% higher in May, unchanged from April but above expectations, while core prices also rose, a troubling development for the BOE in its efforts to curb inflation.

item.title: Europe New Car Sales Jump in May
item.description: New car registrations in Europe rose 18.5% from last May, with battery-electric vehicles taking a bigger market share, but total year-to-date sales remained 23% lower than pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Lufthansa Divests Payments Business
item.description: Lufthansa has agreed to sell its payments specialist AirPlus to SEB for €450 million and said it expected the deal to have a positive effect on its adjusted operating margin and return on capital.

item.title: Masayoshi Son Wants SoftBank to Lead the AI Revolution
item.description: The CEO said he was devoting himself to artificial intelligence and new inventions after what he described as a tear-filled rethinking of his life’s mission.

item.title: Rescue Crews Race Against Time to Locate Missing Titanic Sub
item.description: U.S. and Canadian ships and planes worked to try to locate a missing submersible carrying five people that disappeared days earlier on a mission to see the deep-sea remains of the Titanic shipwreck.

item.title: U.S. Tracked ZTE, Huawei Workers at Suspected Chinese Spy Sites in Cuba
item.description: Intelligence bolstered suspicions that China’s telecom giants might be playing a role in the expansion of Beijing’s eavesdropping capabilities on the island.

item.title: At 3M, Lawsuits Threaten to Transform the Company
item.description: Analysts say a dividend cut and a heavier debt load loom for the Scotch tape maker amid potential settlement payments costing billions.

item.title: Vacant Offices Are Piling Up in Silicon Valley
item.description: Layoffs and hybrid-work patterns are reducing corporate footprints in Northern California towns.

item.title: Pandemic Learning Slide Continues for 13-Year-Olds, Making Full Recovery Unlikely
item.description: National math scores from 2022 are the worst in decades, forecasting struggles in high school and college.

item.title: Novo Nordisk sued several spas and clinics, alleging they illegally said they were selling custom-made versions of Ozempic and other company medicines to people trying to shed pounds.
item.description: Novo Nordisk sued several spas and clinics, alleging they illegally said they were selling custom-made versions of Ozempic and other company medicines to people trying to shed pounds.

item.title: Alibaba named Brooklyn Nets owner Joe Tsai to be its chairman, putting the close ally of fellow co-founder Jack Ma atop the Chinese e-commerce giant as it seeks a revival from sluggish growth amid fierce competition.
item.description: Alibaba named Brooklyn Nets owner Joe Tsai to be its chairman, putting the close ally of fellow co-founder Jack Ma atop the Chinese e-commerce giant as it seeks a revival from sluggish growth amid fierce competition.

item.title: The judge overseeing the prosecution of Trump on charges that he illegally retained and shared national-defense information ordered a trial to begin as soon as Aug. 14, a timeline expectedto be delayed by pretrial litigation.
item.description: The judge overseeing the prosecution of Trump on charges that he illegally retained and shared national-defense information ordered a trial to begin as soon as Aug. 14, a timeline expected to be delayed by pretrial litigation.

item.title: U.S. stocks fell to kick off a short week of trading, with the S&P 500, Dow industrials and Nasdaq losing 0.5%, 0.7% and 0.2%, respectively.
item.description: U.S. stocks fell to kick off a short week of trading, with the S&P 500, Dow industrials and Nasdaq losing 0.5%, 0.7% and 0.2%, respectively.
